snippet: No matter how much attention will be shifted to the Mississippi runoff election, the intractable inertia of the typical voter will play a big role.
abstract: The Upshot Political Memo examines Republican Sen Thad Cochran's strategy for runoff election against Tea Party candidate Chris McDaniel by tapping into his much-larger pool of past supporters in Mississippi; notes strategy runs headlong into intractable inertia of the typical American voter, as history suggests vast majority of people will not bother to vote in this sort of intraparty contest.
lead_paragraph: No matter how much attention will be shifted to the Mississippi runoff election, the intractable inertia of the typical voter will play a big role.

headline.main: How Thad Cochran Is Trying to Avoid Eric Cantor’s Fate
headline.print_headline: Mississippi Senator Has a Plan for Avoiding a Cantor-Like Fate
